title: Coloring Definition
content: **Coloring S n k** is a function from n-element subsets of S to k colors (Fin k). Used to formalize partition calculus.

title: Homogeneous Set
content: **IsHomogeneous H n c i** means all n-subsets of H receive color i. This is the Ramsey-theoretic notion of monochromatic sets.

title: Order Type Bound
content: **HasOrderTypeAtLeast S H Œ±** means H has cardinality at least Œ±.card. Simplified from full order type comparison for this formalization.

title: Partition Arrow
content: **PartitionArrow Œ∫ Œ± m** means Œ∫ ‚Üí (Œ±, m)‚ÇÇ¬≥: for any 2-coloring of 3-subsets of a Œ∫-sized set, either there's a homogeneous set of order type Œ± for color 0, or size m for color 1.

title: Continuum Cardinal
content: **continuum_card = 2^‚Ñµ‚ÇÄ** is the cardinality of the real numbers. The problem asks about partition properties of this cardinal.

title: Countable Ordinal
content: **IsCountableOrdinal Œ±** means Œ±.card ‚â§ ‚Ñµ‚ÇÄ. The problem concerns partition relations for all such ordinals.

title: œâ is Countable
content: The first infinite ordinal œâ (omega0) has cardinality exactly ‚Ñµ‚ÇÄ, making it countable.

title: Erd≈ës-Rado Theorem
content: **Partial Result**: ùî† ‚Üí (œâ+n, 4)‚ÇÇ¬≥ for all 2 ‚â§ n < œâ. This is the strongest known result toward the full conjecture.

title: Erd≈ës Problem 70 (OPEN)
content: **Main Conjecture**: For all countable Œ≤ and 2 ‚â§ n < œâ, does ùî† ‚Üí (Œ≤, n)‚ÇÇ¬≥ hold? The general case beyond œâ+n remains OPEN.

title: Case Œ≤ = œâ
content: **conjecture_omega n** asks whether ùî† ‚Üí (œâ, n)‚ÇÇ¬≥. This follows from Erd≈ës-Rado by monotonicity.

title: Case Œ≤ = œâ¬≤
content: **conjecture_omega_squared n** asks whether ùî† ‚Üí (œâ¬≤, n)‚ÇÇ¬≥. This case is strictly stronger than Erd≈ës-Rado.

title: Case Œ≤ = œâ^œâ
content: **conjecture_omega_tower n** asks whether ùî† ‚Üí (œâ^œâ, n)‚ÇÇ¬≥. œâ^œâ is the first epsilon number limit.

title: Finite Ramsey Theorem
content: For any r, k, n there exists N such that any k-coloring of n-subsets of an N-set has a homogeneous r-set. The finite analogue of partition calculus.

title: R(3,3) = 6
content: **Ramsey's Theorem**: Any 2-coloring of 3-subsets of a 6-element set has a monochromatic 3-subset. Classic result in finite Ramsey theory.

title: Counterexample Form
content: **erdos_70_counterexample** describes what a counterexample would look like: some countable Œ≤ and n ‚â• 2 with ùî† ‚Üõ (Œ≤, n)‚ÇÇ¬≥.

title: Mutual Exclusivity
content: The conjecture and counterexample are mutually exclusive and exhaustive: exactly one must hold.

title: Ordinal Monotonicity
content: If Œ∫ ‚Üí (Œ≤, m)‚ÇÇ¬≥ and Œ± ‚â§ Œ≤, then Œ∫ ‚Üí (Œ±, m)‚ÇÇ¬≥. Smaller ordinals are easier to find as homogeneous sets.

title: Size Monotonicity
content: If Œ∫ ‚Üí (Œ±, n)‚ÇÇ¬≥ and m ‚â§ n, then Œ∫ ‚Üí (Œ±, m)‚ÇÇ¬≥. Smaller finite sets are easier to find.

title: œâ + n is Countable
content: For any n, œâ + n has cardinality ‚Ñµ‚ÇÄ + n = ‚Ñµ‚ÇÄ, so it's countable. Uses ordinal addition and cardinal absorption.

title: œâ¬≤ is Countable
content: œâ * œâ has cardinality ‚Ñµ‚ÇÄ * ‚Ñµ‚ÇÄ = ‚Ñµ‚ÇÄ, making œâ¬≤ countable. Ordinal multiplication maps to cardinal multiplication.
